title: DA: 2 men indicted in shooting death of 7-year-old Iris Rodriguez
content:
SAN ANTONIO – Two men have been indicted in the early June shooting death of a 7-year-old girl, according to the Bexar County Criminal District Attorney’s Office.
Frank Gomez, 28, and Manuel Watson, 22, were indicted on a capital murder charge for the death of Iris Rodriguez, a news release said Friday.
RELATED: Officials: Suspect in shooting death of 7-year-old Iris Rodriguez found dead in his cell
A third suspect, Jonathan Campos, 22, committed suicide in July at the Bexar County Jail, while Peter Gonzalez, 22, was arrested in connection to the death but has not been indicted as of this time and his case is currently under review, the D.A’s office said.
The cases are pending in the 187th District Court.
The incident occurred June 1, when the suspects were leaving Cuellar Park on the West Side at about 10 p.m. in the 5000 block of San Fernando Street.
Witness told police the suspects approached the child, her mother and her mother’s boyfriend before at least one of them pulled out a gun and shot them. A previous report by mySA.com states the shooting may have stemmed from a dispute following a basketball game at the park.
Iris Rodriguez was shot in the head and later died at University Hospital, while her mom and the boyfriend suffered minor injuries, according to a previous report and the D.A.’s office.
Capital murder is a felony with a potential punishment of life in prison without parole or the death penalty. Meanwhile, aggravated assault with a deadly weapon is a second-degree felony with a possibility of up to 20 years in prison and a fine.
